text: I’ve visited Boon Tong Kee many times over many years, and it remains a dependable choice for chicken rice. The rice is consistently fragrant and flavourful, and the chicken and other side dishes are decent and reliable. The chili and ginger sauces are a bit too salty for my taste, sometimes overpowering the more subtle flavours. Still, it’s a place I return to regularly—especially when I have friends visiting from overseas, as it offers a solid introduction to local favourites.

Coming for the tender kampung chicken with fragrant oil rice. There was a long queue on Saturday night at around 7pm-ish, and we waited for 15 mins to get a table. The dishes came quite fast. Recommended if you are looking for a slightly premium place for chicken rice.

Initially a plate of chicken got a little bug was served, and the waitress helped us to change a new plate and apologized and gave us 20% off. That's very good service in Singapore actually! 🤣 The chicken is definitely goooood love it so much 🫶🏻🫶🏻🫶🏻
One of the best chicken rice i ever eat. Like Cantonese always say. Chicken must have chicken taste

came in during dinner time, just had to queue a bit, and we got to order while queuing so we got our food quite fast. ordered the usual boiled chicken, rice and fried tofu, also first time trying their sweet sour pork. everything were really good, their portions also worth the price. fyi the wet tissue isnt free so, if you dont wanna be charged with it just gave it back to the cashier when youre paying ✌️
